lenders.name: Katya

I loan because I can.

lenders.occupational_info: I have recently left my job as a retail manager (selling clothes and managing a clothing store) to raise my newborn son (who will be due this year in June).

lenders.name: Aeron

lenders.occupational_info: I paint paintings in watercolor and oil of landscapes and the beautiful scenery around Virginia.  I also train horses and rescue horses in need and fix them up and find them good homes.

lenders.name: Pete
lenders.loan_because: I feel that it is so much more empowering to loan people money to build self-sustaining ventures than it is to just give money to solve an immediate need.  I think Kiva is an incredible program.
lenders.occupational_info: I help small business owners in the U.S. decide what they really want, make plans to reach these goals, and then overcome all the obstacles they face while executing their plan.

lenders.name: Doug
lenders.loan_because: I admire the strength and drive of the entrepreneurs.
lenders.occupational_info: I work with a team of people who work to keep our country safe.

lenders.name: David
lenders.loan_because: I want to help those who have a vision for improving their life.  It's personally motivating to see and read about others around the world that will not let any obstacles block them from achieving their dreams.
lenders.occupational_info: I am in the computer industry and work with a team that manages a large number of web servers.

lenders.name: Susan
lenders.loan_because: It is a privilege to help people have better lives.

lenders.name: MBG & Mindy Millington
lenders.loan_because: I have needed a helping hand before, and I know what it is like to just need a little more capital to become successful.  God has given me and my family so much, I like to give back when I can.
lenders.occupational_info:
I Custom Design Websites and I help individuals get started in a home based business online and offline.

If anyone would like to work from home using their computers with no risk, please visit  www.GoFearless.com.

lenders.occupational_info: I am a teacher of 4year old children. Most of my students come from Haiti. I like the idea that I am helping a haitian woman start a business.

lenders.name: Melissa
lenders.loan_because: I want to make a difference in the world, and this is a simple yet effective way to help people in need.

lenders.name: Cindi
lenders.loan_because: The amount of money wasted in developed nations is obscene, and I want to do what I can.

lenders.name: Olivia

lenders.name: Tammy

lenders.occupational_info: I am going to school to learn how to help the elderly stay active.

lenders.name: Sergio

Many of us can give up 25 bucks every every so often and not feel the pinch.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a photographer that shoots travel, extreme adventure sports and outdoor lifestyle.

"Under the bright sun, many of us are gathered together with different languages, different styles of dress, even different faiths. However, all of us are the same in being humans, and we all uniquely have the thought of I, and we´re all the same in wanting happiness and in wanting to avoid suffering."

lenders.loan_because: I want to empower people to build their own sustainable lives.
lenders.occupational_info: I help people cope with difficult feelings when their feelings are making it hard for them to work and love.

lenders.name: Derek and Amy
lenders.loan_because: I believe God loves people all over the world, and because of this, that I should be concerned about the welfare of people all over the world.
lenders.occupational_info: Derek is studying the Bible and Christianity at a Bible college, and I (Amy) am studying elementary education.  We both want to work internationally telling people about God after we graduate.

lenders.name: Fabio & family
lenders.loan_because: I think Kiva is an effective way to help people in other countries. Probably one of the best way to use money.

lenders.name: Jana
lenders.loan_because: I do not believe in investing in stocks, mutual funds, etc. To me, those things are part of the problem. I do not want to invest in that which is destroying the world. I want to transform my money into something useful and real that creates positive change. I especially want to help other farmers, the ones that feed us!
lenders.occupational_info: I grow vegetables organically, without any chemical fertilizers, pesticides, herbicides. I sell at a summer farmers' market in Victoria BC.

lenders.name: Jake Brown
lenders.loan_because: I know how it feels to start a business from scratch without any help.
lenders.occupational_info: I do all kinds of things, but mostly I run a business with my brother.

lenders.name: Nathan & Bethany

lenders.occupational_info: We are passionate about loving people and inviting them to join God in the renewal of all things

lenders.name: Karen

lenders.occupational_info: I have helped refugee children from Viet Nam find families in the U.S., supervised the work of interpreters who help patients talk with their doctors.

lenders.name: Brian and Natalie

lenders.occupational_info: as a farmer  we would like to increased our farming production to contributes on food production and to increased members income.

lenders.name: VICTOR
lenders.loan_because: Providing micro credits is the best way of having a huge impact improving lives in a sustainable manner. If each of us does it individually it is good; but if we do it in a combined, flexible manner through platforms like KIVA then the impact is massive. Good job Kiva!!
lenders.occupational_info: I also run an association that promotes vital energy work, such as yoga, qigong, and others, to people.

lenders.name: Jill

lenders.occupational_info: I provide technical assistance to agriculture development projects to improve lives, sustainably.

lenders.name: Andrea
lenders.loan_because: it helps :-)

lenders.name: Jaime

lenders.occupational_info: I am a single mother of two and understand the challenges that come with being a parent and businessperson.  I want to teach my children to think outside the box, to create ways in which to be successful while making a difference in others' lives as well.

lenders.name: HOPEsudbury
lenders.loan_because: After the tragic events of September 11, 2001, people in Sudbury joined together and asked, "What can we do to help?" The Sudbury Public Schools Superintendent and Town Manager called a few people to meet. Those people called a few more and HOPEsudbury was born—a diverse group of residents, town employees and business people—young and old—joining together as a community to help others who might need support, encouragement and financial assistance.
lenders.occupational_info: Since its establishment in 2002, HOPEsudbury (which stands for Humanitarian Outreach Project) has sponsored a variety of activities and events designed to strengthen community ties while raising money, collecting items and showing support for people in need.
